element.title: Radio
element.desc: The radio tag provides a simple radio button.
element.longdescription:
Note: Redmond components are deprecated. Please consider using LZ Components. If you use this component, you must explicitly include the redmond library:
<include href="redmond"/>

Arguments:
group
default: null
A string specifying the group name that the radio button belongs to.

label
default: "nul"
A string specifying the text to be displayed to right of the radio button.

selected
default: FALSE
When selected is set to TRUE, the radio button starts in the selected state.

Description:
The radio tag provides a simple radio button. There can only be one selected radio button per group. Groups are automatically determined by the view they share if they're not implicitly defined using the group attribute.

Example:

<canvas height="100">
    <include href="redmond"/>

    <view>
        <radio label="Check me A1" selected="true"/>
        <radio label="Check me A2"/>
        <radio label="Check me A3"/>
        <simplelayout axis="x" spacing="4"/>
    </view>
    <view>
        <radio label="Check me B1" selected="true"/>
        <radio label="Check me B2"/>
        <radio label="Check me B3"/>
        <simplelayout axis="x" spacing="4"/>
    </view>
    <simplelayout axis="y" spacing="4"/>
</canvas>
